title: 10 Things to Do when a Guy Is Kissing Your Neck

steps.title: A neck kiss probably means he wants to make out.
steps.content: A neck kiss probably means he wants to make out . If you two were chatting or having a conversation, now’s your cue to stop talking. Don’t try to keep your conversation going—that could be a little awkward. If you don’t know what else to do, just don’t say anything. [1] X Research source This is especially true if he comes up behind you to kiss your neck.

steps.title: Let him know that you’re into what he’s doing.
steps.content: Let him know that you’re into what he’s doing. When he starts kissing your neck, tilt your head just slightly to the side so more of your neck is exposed. That way, he can reach all up and down your neck as well as behind your ear. [2] X Expert Source Eddy Baller Dating Coach Expert Interview. 7 February 2020. It’s a great way to encourage him without saying a word.

steps.title: A small gasp means he’s doing well.
steps.content: A small gasp means he’s doing well. If you’re surprised by what he’s doing or shocked by how good it feels, try letting out a little gasp. This sharp intake of breath will encourage him to keep going. [3] X Research source You might just do this automatically, especially if you’ve never been kissed on the neck before.

steps.title: This noise tells him that you like what he’s doing.
steps.content: This noise tells him that you like what he’s doing. Don’t force it, but let any noises that you want to make come out naturally. It will be his cue to continue, and he might even start kissing your neck more often. [4] X Research source Your moan doesn’t have to be super loud or aggressive. Sometimes, a soft moan is enough to get the message across.

steps.title: You can go for his neck or his torso.
steps.content: You can go for his neck or his torso. It’ll give you something to do with your hands, and it will encourage him to keep kissing your neck. If you two are lying down, you could even run your hands along his chest or arms. [5] X Expert Source Eddy Baller Dating Coach Expert Interview. 7 February 2020. If he’s kissing your neck from behind you, spin around and embrace him.

steps.title: Reach around him and hold him tightly.
steps.content: Reach around him and hold him tightly. Pull his body in toward yours to let him know you like what’s going on. If you couple this action with a small gasp or a moan, he’ll definitely get the hint that he’s doing something right. [6] X Research source If you two are lying down together, try pulling your body slightly on top of his.

steps.title: Guys like having their hair played with too!
steps.content: Guys like having their hair played with too! While he’s occupied with kissing your neck, reach up and run your hands through his hair a bit. It will tousle his hair and give him a nice bedhead look, too. [7] X Research source Work your hands through his hair slowly and gently. There’s nothing worse than catching your fingers on a tangle when you’re trying to be sweet and sexy! Stroke his scalp if he’s bald or shaved.

steps.title: Overall, try not to overthink it.
steps.content: Overall, try not to overthink it. If you like what he’s doing and it feels good, just relax and enjoy it. Chances are, the guy is kissing your neck because he likes you and he wants you to feel good. Whatever happens, happens! [8] X Research source Getting a neck kiss is a fun way to spice up a makeout session, too. He might be trying to impress you with a new move.

steps.title: A neck kiss can be an invitation to move things further.
steps.content: A neck kiss can be an invitation to move things further. If you’re both fully clothed and he starts kissing your neck, reach for the bottom of his shirt to start taking it off. Make sure he’s okay with it (you could even ask “Is this okay?”), then peel off his shirt and start feeling his body. [9] X Research source Neck kisses aren’t always an invitation to go a step further. If you have any doubts or he starts pulling away, ask him if he’s okay with what’s happening.

steps.title: Unless you want one, of course.
steps.content: Unless you want one, of course. Neck kisses are great, but they can lead to a small mouth-shaped bruise, or hickey . If you have to look professional or go to a job, getting a hickey probably isn’t the best idea. Gently remind him that he can keep going, but to lay off any sucking or nibbling he might be doing. [10] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Just say something like, “That feels so good. Just don’t give me a hickey, okay?”
